metadata.title: CVE-2017-17566 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x allowing PV guest OS users tocause a denial of service (host OS crash) or gain host OS privileges inshadow mode by mapping a certain auxiliary page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.9 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.7-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.8-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-4.9 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xenstore-utils - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu1').
